answers.text: No, players are not allowed to have an "Under-age" waiver for the IIHF Ice Hockey U18 Women’s World Championship.

qas.question: According to the IIHF Statutes and Bylaws, what is the age limit for players in the Women’s Hockey “Under 18” and “Under-aged” category?

answers.text: Players in the Women’s Hockey “Under 18” and “Under-aged” category must be between fifteen (15) and eighteen (18) years old by December 31 of the year in which the Championship Season ends.

paragraphs.context: In Women’s Hockey “bodychecking” is allowed when there is a clear intention of playing the puck or attempting to “gain possession” of the puck with the exception from the situation described in this rule. If two (2) Players are in pursuit of the puck, they are reasonably allowed to push and lean into each other provided that “possession of the puck” remains the sole object of the two (2) Players. A player that makes an illegal hit on an opponent described in this rule will be assessed one of a: (I) Minor Penalty (2’) (II) Major Penalty (5’) and automatic Game Misconduct Penalty If two (2) or more Players are competing for “possession of the puck”, they are not allowed to use the boards to make contact with an opponent to eliminate her from the play, push her into the boards, or pin her along the boards. A Player, who is stationary, is entitled to that area of the ice. It is up to the opponent to avoid body contact with such a Player. If that Player is stationed between the opponent and the puck, the opponent is obliged to skate around the stationary Player. If a Player with the puck is skating directly at an opponent who is stationary, it is the obligation of the puck carrier to “avoid contact”. But, if the puck carrier makes every effort to “avoid contact” and the opponent moves into the puck carrier, that opponent will be assessed at least a Minor Penalty (2’) for an “illegal hit”. Players are allowed to “hold their ground” any time that they have established their position on the ice. No player is required to move out of the way of an oncoming player to avoid a collision. Any move by a Player to step or glide into an opposing Player will be assessed at least a Minor Penalty (2’) for an “illegal hit”.

qas.question: What penalty will a player receive for making an illegal hit on an opponent in Women's Hockey as described in the rule?

answers.text: A player making an illegal hit on an opponent in Women's Hockey, as described in the rule, will receive either a Minor Penalty (2') or a Major Penalty (5') with an automatic Game Misconduct Penalty.

qas.question: When are players allowed to push and lean into each other in Women's Hockey according to the rule?

answers.text: Players are allowed to push and lean into each other in Women's Hockey when they are in pursuit of the puck and their sole objective is to gain possession of it.

qas.question: What actions are prohibited when two or more players are competing for possession of the puck in Women's Hockey?

answers.text: When two or more players are competing for possession of the puck in Women's Hockey, they are prohibited from using the boards to make contact, push, or pin an opponent.

qas.question: In Women's Hockey, what is the obligation of a player who is stationary and has established their position on the ice when an opponent is skating towards them with the puck?

answers.text: When an opponent is skating towards a stationary player with the puck, it is the obligation of the puck carrier to avoid contact.

qas.question: What penalty will be assessed if a player makes an illegal hit by stepping or gliding into an opposing player in Women's Hockey?

answers.text: If a player makes an illegal hit by stepping or gliding into an opposing player in Women's Hockey, they will be assessed at least a Minor Penalty (2').

paragraphs.context: All Players in the "Senior" age category must wear a full-face protection (full-visor, or cage facial protection), properly fixed to the helmet. For violation of this rule, after warning by the Referee, a Minor Penalty shall be imposed. (Rule 12 – Illegal Equipment) Younger Players in the “Under 18” age category who participate in the “Senior” age category must wear the protective equipment as specified and described for the “Under 18” age category.

paragraphs.context: According to the IIHF Statutes and Bylaws, the Player eligibility and age categories are defined as follows: “Under 20” Age Category The players participating in any IIHF Ice Hockey U20 World Championship must be eligible to compete as a male athlete of the male gender and be no younger than fifteen (15) years of age, and no older than twenty (20) years of age, on December 31 of the year in which the Championship Season ends. No under-age waiver is permitted. “Under 18” Age Category The players participating in any IIHF Ice Hockey U18 World Championship must be eligible to compete as a male athlete and be no younger than fifteen (15) years of age, and no older than eighteen (18) years of age, by December 31 of the year in which the Championship Season ends. No under-age waiver is permitted. ( » For more information refer to IIHF Statutes & Bylaws.)

qas.question: What is the age range for players eligible to compete in the IIHF Ice Hockey U20 World Championship?

answers.text: Players eligible to compete in the IIHF Ice Hockey U20 World Championship must be between the ages of 15 and 20 years old on December 31 of the Championship Season.

qas.question: According to the IIHF Statutes and Bylaws, what is the minimum age requirement for male athletes participating in the U18 Age Category?

answers.text: Male athletes participating in the U18 Age Category must be at least 15 years old and no older than 18 years old by December 31 of the year in which the Championship Season ends, according to the IIHF Statutes and Bylaws.

qas.question: Are under-age waivers permitted for players competing in the IIHF Ice Hockey U20 World Championship?

answers.text: No, under-age waivers are not permitted for players competing in the IIHF Ice Hockey U20 World Championship.

qas.question: What is the maximum age limit for male athletes participating in the U18 Age Category of the IIHF Ice Hockey U18 World Championship?

answers.text: The maximum age limit for male athletes participating in the U18 Age Category of the IIHF Ice Hockey U18 World Championship is eighteen (18) years old.

qas.question: According to the provided details, what is the age requirement for male athletes to be eligible for the U20 Age Category in the IIHF Ice Hockey World Championship?

answers.text: Male athletes must be between fifteen (15) and twenty (20) years of age to be eligible for the U20 Age Category in the IIHF Ice Hockey World Championship.
